data_table.description: The dataset provides information about affection status (i.e. Major Depressive Disorder, diagnosed through application of the 'Composite International Diagnostic Interview' [CIDI]), menopausal status, BMI, and lifestyle variables, including alcohol consumption and smoking habits, plus sociodemographic data of participants. Several of the variables were measured twice, at time of the CIDI interview and at a later time during the study.

variable.name: MDD
variable.description: Lifetime Major Depressive Disorder, diagnosed by CIDI interview
variable.comment: NESDA by interview, NTR normal population risk

variable.name: Smoker
variable.description: Current smoker at time of sampling

variable.name: Alcohol
variable.description: Alcohol drinker (ever 12 glasses or more per year)

variable.name: Menostat
variable.description: Menopause status at time of sampling

variable.name: BMI
variable.description: Body mass index at time of sampling

variable.name: Age2
variable.description: Age at time of second sampling

variable.name: Nweeks
variable.description: Number of weeks between first and second sampling

variable.name: MDD2
variable.description: Major Depressive Disorder diagnosed since initial CIDI interview
variable.comment: NESDA by interview, NTR normal population risk

variable.name: Smoker2
variable.description: Current smoker at time of second sampling

variable.name: Alcohol2
variable.description: Alcohol drinker (ever 12 glasses or more per year) at second sampling

variable.name: Menostat2
variable.description: Menopause status at time of second sampling

variable.name: BMI2
variable.description: Body mass index at time of second sampling
